metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25648 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the way NSS handled CCS (ChangeCipherSpec) messages inTLS 1.3. This flaw allows a remote attacker to send multiple CCS messages,causing a denial of service for servers compiled with the NSS library. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. This flawaffects NSS versions before 3.58.

criterions.comment: nss: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
